title: 105_hr2949
content: The Missouri and Middle Mississippi Rivers Enhancement Project is outlined in Section 1. The Middle Mississippi River and Missouri River are defined in this section. The project authorized by the Secretary of the Army is outlined, including protection and enhancement activities to be developed within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The Secretary of the Army is authorized to develop a plan for protecting and enhancing fish and wildlife habitat in the Missouri River and middle Mississippi River region without adversely affecting water-related needs. The plan authorized by the Secretary of the Army aims to protect and enhance fish and wildlife habitat in the Missouri River and middle Mississippi River region while considering water-related needs and private property rights. Required activities include modifying navigation training structures to benefit habitat. The plan authorized by the Secretary of the Army aims to protect and enhance fish and wildlife habitat in the Missouri River and middle Mississippi River region. Required activities include modifying navigation training structures, creating side channels, restoring island habitat, creating riverine habitat, and establishing criteria for prioritizing habitat types. The plan aims to protect and enhance fish and wildlife habitat in the Missouri River and middle Mississippi River region by implementing activities such as modifying navigation structures, creating side channels, restoring island and riverine habitat, establishing criteria for prioritizing activities, and conducting monitoring for project evaluation. The Secretary will use available funds to carry out these activities. The Secretary will implement activities to protect and enhance fish and wildlife habitat in the Missouri River using available funds. This includes designing and constructing features of the project to accelerate completion. The Secretary can modify an authorized project to accelerate activities for fish and wildlife habitat protection in the Missouri River or middle Mississippi River, as long as it aligns with project purposes. The integration of these activities with other Federal and State activities is required, without affecting existing authority. In subsection (b), the Secretary must integrate activities with other Federal and State activities without affecting existing authority for specific projects. Nebraska is authorized by various water resources development acts, and the new section does not confer any new regulatory authority. Public participation is required in developing and carrying out the plan. The new section does not grant additional regulatory authority. Public participation is mandated in developing and implementing the plan, including advance notice of meetings and maintaining records. Compliance with applicable federal laws, including environmental policies, is required. The Secretary must comply with applicable federal laws, including the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969. The non-Federal share of project costs should not exceed 25%, with a Federal share limit of $5,000,000 per activity. Operation and maintenance of the project are the Federal responsibility. Authorization of appropriations is required. (g) Authorization of Appropriations: $50,000,000 is authorized for fiscal years 1999 through 2004 to cover the Federal share of project costs. The funds will be managed by the Mississippi Valley Division of the Army Corps of Engineers and distributed to the appropriate Districts.
